lexUnit.name: lazy.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: averse to work, activity, or exertion

sentence.text: Anyway , that is one of his reasons for not switching over to a metric standard for his stupid measurements , though in fact he 's just lazy .
STUDENTS are lazy , drink too much and take drugs , according to a survey .
These young people are rarely lazy -- they 're virtually always depressed and afraid of rejection they ca n't handle .
Freud thought that the masses were lazy , and did not want to impose the instinctual renunciations necessary for civilization on themselves .
In hot weather cold poached salmon or sea bass is the lazy cook 's dream .
The Scottish are n't lazy like the English .
Pairs classes are useful for gaining confidence or if your horse is lazy .
` Russian men are very lazy ; they sit back and wait .
My body is lazy like loose yam , but I 'm not sick yet .
Many people today are too lazy even to open a tin .
Mr Smith complains that his second wife is lazy .
` I did n't have the most stamina in the world , I was called a lazy player but I could have played till midnight .

Logic suggests that blame for such a situation must usually be equally divided , and that there are just as many bad , uncaring or downright lazy mothers as there bad , selfish and irresponsible fathers .
He lifted his hand and trailed a lazy finger across her cheek .
I heard him grumbling to Mum about lazy teachers with 6 weeks holiday .
She heard Rab , ` Get up ya lazy swine , " but Phillis did not stir ; there was little he could do .
No time to make breakfast for a lazy wife . "
Those working around Reagan soon discovered that he was a very lazy president .
You will get the lazy child who copies what the next child is doing and these copiers must be helped to think for themselves .
` Lazy sod , " said Jonquil , ` do him good . "
Lazy people develop great cunning in ways of getting by without working .
But I warn you , he 's going to write to your father and brother and tell them what a completely fat lazy arse you are , Changez .
He allegedly called hospital workers ` lazy bastards " .
Total tranquility is what it 's about up here ; not a sound but the lazy buzzing of insects , the whirring of grasshoppers and the distant tinkle of a cow bell , just ideal for a relaxing break .
Lucker plays lazy games .
From time to time she dipped her fingertips into a glass jar and withdrew them laden with cream which she smoothed into her face and neck in lazy strokes .

GUIL : ( Excitedly ) Out of the void , finally , a sound ; while on a boat ( admittedly ) outside the action ( admittedly ) the perfect and absolute silence of the wet lazy slap of water against water and the rolling creak of timber -- breaks ; giving rise at once to the speculation or the assumption or the hope that something is about to happen ; a pipe is heard .
He ravished her senses , draining her of any will to fight , and then let his tongue flicker in lazy exploration along the full pink curve of her lips .
He lifted one tanned shoulder in a lazy shrug .
He gave a slow , lazy smile .
The sunshine when she landed at Heathrow was a cruel reminder to Alyssia of the lazy days in France she had thought would never end .
For a while now there 'd been no sound save the lazy creak of the sails and the soft slap of water against their bows .
Oh , how can a child of mine be so lazy and disobedient so ungrateful ? "
I 'm a secretary to pay the rent , and a very lazy ex-ballerina with no ambitions other than to have a happy life and be free .
The problem was , he was too lazy to try and stop being lazy ,
I am an extremely lazy cook and nervous of long recipes , complicated sauces or anything risky such as a souffl .
I 'm incredibly lazy but I do think I 've found the right way or at least a better way than hers to live .
I think he just does n't pay attention and he 's quite lazy with his feet . "
I 'm pretty lazy now .
Like all basically lazy people he was content to let things be not only when they were going well , but also when they merely appeared to be going well .
He caught her arm in mid-air , a deceptively lazy reflex action , his fingers biting into her forearm .
I 'm terribly lazy and always put it off until the last minute . "
It was armchair diving -- so comfortable , so relaxed , so delightfully lazy .
And we 're too lazy to do any gardening .
Her mind was still too lazy to concentrate on what they were saying .
